othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Appendix B — Calibration and Test Records

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Contains calibration tables, diagnostic logs, sensor feedback trends and performance analysis data for Electronic Chute Control II system qualification.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: Provide calibration data, diagnostic logs and qualification records for Electronic Chute Control II system

entry.p: PNEUMATIC CHUTE CONTROL MAINTENANCE RECORD
1. Chute air supply is _______ bar / psi Pressure switch is set at _______ bar / psi
2. Machine air “A” supply is _______ bar / psi Pressure switch is set at _____ bar / psi
3. Machine air “B” supply is _______ bar / psi Pressure switch is set at _____ bar / psi
4. Plunger cooling air supply is _______ bar / psi Pressure switch is set at _____ bar / psi
5. Pilot air supply is _______ bar / psi Pressure switch is set at _______ bar / psi
6. The air hoses are in satisfactory condition. ________
7. Quantity Replaced Quantity Repaired Part number
8. Feeder ammeter setpoints:
Low current trip _____ Amps Operating current (Avg.) _____ Amps
High current trip _____ Amps
9. Gob Distributor ammeter setpoints:
Low current trip _____ Amps Operating current (Avg.) _____ Amps
High current trip _____ Amps
10. Shear lockout air pressure switch is _______ bar / psi Pressure switch is set at _______ bar / psi
11. Chute control testing.
A. Stop the feeder. Chute control functions correctly. _____
B. Stop the shears. Chute control functions correctly. _____
C. Stop the gob distributor. Chute control functions correctly. _____
D. Gob distributor run/setup switch functions correctly. _____
E. Push the chute-up button on the main panel. Chute control functions correctly. _____
F. Push the reject button on the main panel. Chute control functions correctly. _____
G. Push the emergency chute-up button on the main panel. Chute control functions correctly. _____
H. Push the reject button on the remote panel. Chute control functions correctly. _____
I. Push the chute-up button on the remote panel. Chute control functions correctly. _____
J. Push the emergency chute-up stand-alone button. Chute control functions correctly. ____
K. Test and calibrate the chute air, machine air “A”, machine air “B”, plunger cooling, and pilot air pressure switches. Chute control functions correctly. _____
L. Test the chute water flow solenoid. The solenoid is functional. _____
9. The speed screws are adjusted correctly. ______
